job.title: Software Engineer, DevOps
job.description:
Hart is a health technology company founded in 2012 in Orange County, California, to improve the ways in which people inside and outside of the industry access and engage with health data.
HART IS UNABLE TO SPONSOR VISAS AT THIS TIME
You will be working with a team of DevOps engineers planning, building, and maintaining a complex service-oriented architecture, running in our private cloud and on our own hardware. The core of our automation is built around open source tools, specifically Saltstack, Consul, Vault and Gitlab.
We want the operator who can build a solution, demonstrate its viability, and get that code integrated with high velocity and accuracy. We are very careful about time management and we know that top performance means focused, directed effort. Distractions in the form of shifting priorities are a no-go at Hart.
You will have a large degree of control over the direction you decide to take when solving a given problem, and you’ll have any support you need to make things happen. Responsibility is distributed and individuals are absolutely held responsible for their choices. Deadlines and artificial pressure are low but the culture is one that rewards appropriate effort. We take burnout and overexertion very seriously but understand this is a high-paced environment.
Finally, Ops at Hart has the sole focus of serving the needs of some very talented development teams. Remembering that our customers are our teammates on the data and platform teams keeps us aligned with the company’s needs. When Ops does our job well, we enable the other teams to meet their goals more quickly, ultimately driving company success.
Help us improve how patients interact with the healthcare industry as a whole and make healthcare actionable.
Required Skillset
3+ years of in-depth automation experience using configuration management tools, such as Puppet, Ansible, or Salt
Linux Experience Only
Experience with Containers, Docker
Direct involvement with 24/7/365 production environment
Ability to manage individual projects and escalated workload
Advanced troubleshooting, problem analysis, and critical thinking skills
Excellent writing and verbal communication skills, including presentation skills and the ability to write technical data for non-technical audience
Experience with cloud providers (AWS, Azure, Google)
Preferred Qualifications
Experience building and maintaining Apache Hadoop or Amazon EMR
Knowledge of Software Defined Networking, Software and Hardware VPNs
Knowledge of Elasticsearch, Logstash and Kibana
Knowledge of IaC frameworks such as Terraform w/ Terragrunt
Experience with open source nosql databases such as MongoDB
Experience with memory key/value stores like Redis
Demonstrated experience with data security and physical security needs in a mission critical environment
Familiarity with SmartOS
Familiarity with private cloud solutions such as Triton or OpenStack
Nice to have -- experience with Druid or scaling Postgres
Employee Benefits Package
100% Medical, Dental and Vision coverage for you and your family
Unlimited Vacation Policy
Paid Maternity and Paternity Leave
Life Insurance
AD&D Insurance
Fully remote work
Wellness Stipend
401(k) plan
Flexible Spending Account and Dependent Care Account
NO THIRD PARTY RECRUITERS PLEASE
